footerSections.title: ABOUT DUCKDUCKGO
footerSections.description: DuckDuckGo is the independent Internet privacy company for anyone who’s tired of being tracked online and wants an easy solution. Unlike Chrome and other browsers, our free, go-to browser comes with over a dozen powerful privacy protections built-in, including our search engine that replaces Google and doesn't track your search history. The DuckDuckGo browser’s uniquely comprehensive privacy protections are used by tens of millions of people to protect their everyday online activities, from searching to browsing, emailing, and more. Available for download on Mac, Windows, iOS, and Android.

accordionItems.title: What is DuckDuckGo?
accordionItems.content: DuckDuckGo is an independent Internet privacy company that aims to make getting privacy simple and accessible for everyone. Our free web browser for iOS, Android, Mac, and Windows lets you search and browse the web, but — unlike Google Search and Chrome — we don’t track your searches or browsing history, and we block other companies from trying to track you, all by default. Learn more.

accordionItems.title: How does DuckDuckGo protect my privacy?
accordionItems.content: DuckDuckGo is an independent alternative to Google that also lets you search and browse the web, but we don’t track your searches or browsing history, and our browsers and extensions help block other companies from tracking you, all by default. Our browser comes with built-in privacy protection, including tracker blocking, enhanced encryption, Email Protection, and more. Learn more

accordionItems.title: Does DuckDuckGo block all trackers on websites I visit?
accordionItems.content: DuckDuckGo never tracks you. And when you leave our search engine and use our browsers or extensions to visit other sites, we aim to protect your privacy as much as possible. No service can eliminate all hidden tracking or online profiling, as trackers are always trying to evade specific protections. To be effective, our protections are continually evolving to mitigate this while also preventing sites from becoming inoperable. This is also why we offer several types of protections against web tracking. Other browsers offer some of these protections by default, such as cookie and fingerprinting protections, but we also offer many other protections that most browsers don't offer by default, such as 3rd-Party Tracker Loading Protection, Global Privacy Control, Link Tracking Protection, CNAME Cloaking Protection, Google AMP Protection, and more, which help cover different types of tracking. Our list of trackers is open source, as is the list of exceptions we've compiled to preserve usability. Learn more.

accordionItems.title: How many people use DuckDuckGo?
accordionItems.content: Our best guess — over 100 million people! We don’t track our users, so it’s impossible to know for sure how many people actually use our product. However, we can estimate based on the number of searches we receive each month. Thanks to all these users, DuckDuckGo has the second largest mobile search market share in the United States and 20 other markets, including Australia, Canada, Spain, Italy, Poland, and the United Kingdom.

accordionItems.title: How does DuckDuckGo make money?
accordionItems.content: We make money from private ads on our search engine. On other search engines, ads are based on profiles compiled from personal information, such as your search, browsing, and purchase history. We don’t have this information (per our Privacy Policy) because search ads on DuckDuckGo are based on the search results page you’re looking at, not what other companies’ tracking algorithms assume about you. For example, if you search for cars, we’ll show you ads about cars. We also make money from the subscription fee users pay to access Privacy Pro, our three-in-one subscription service. Learn more

accordionItems.title: Why use DuckDuckGo instead of Google?
accordionItems.content:
Use DuckDuckGo to stay private online. Have you ever seen ads so creepy it feels like your phone is spying on you? Or ads that keep following you around with something you once searched for? Whose responsibility is that? Probably Google. Google has been tracking your searches for decades by embedding trackers in its Chrome browser and hiding even more trackers on its most popular websites. In contrast, our browser lets you search and browse as usual, but (unlike Google) we never track you. In addition, our browser helps block trackers from Google and other companies that operate other online tracking networks, such as TikTok and Meta (Facebook).
Use DuckDuckGo to enjoy a better online experience. Have you noticed that Google’s search results are getting worse? A lot of people have. For many Google searches, the majority of results on the first page are either ads or Google promoting its own services. On mobile devices, it can be even worse. At DuckDuckGo, we keep ads to a minimum and our search ads are private, based only on the search results page you’re viewing, not on you as a person. By default, our browser’s built-in tracker blocking also blocks many ads that rely on trackers from loading. Along with other browser features like automatic cookie pop-up blocking, our default web tracking protections provide an overall cleaner online experience with DuckDuckGo.
Use DuckDuckGo to send a message to Big Tech. Use DuckDuckGo because it's fast and secure, because it's a free alternative to Google that lets you search and browse the way you want, and because it puts you back in control of your personal data.

accordionItems.title: Is Incognito mode private?
accordionItems.content: No. It's a myth that you can't be tracked when you use so-called "incognito" mode. In fact, all incognito mode does is erase information on your computer. Incognito mode doesn't stop Google from saving your searches, nor does it stop companies, internet service providers, or governments from tracking you online. On the other hand, DuckDuckGo Search never keeps your search history or anyone else's, and the DuckDuckGo browser also helps keep websites private. Learn more

accordionItems.title: How do DuckDuckGo Search results compare to Google's?
accordionItems.content: DuckDuckGo Search gives you truly private search results without compromising on the quality of the results. We have everything you’d expect from an online search experience (images, maps, answers, etc.), and since there’s no search history on DuckDuckGo, you’ll escape the filter bubble of manipulated results. You’ll also get access to bonus features that make our private search engine more convenient and a little more fun. We’re always improving, so you can expect even more improvements to search in the coming year! Learn more

accordionItems.title: Is DuckDuckGo owned by Google or any other entity?
accordionItems.content: No, we are not and have never been owned by Google or any other entity. We have been an independent company since our founding in 2008. We also do not get any of our search results from Google. You may have noticed that we offer a Google Chrome extension and a Google Android app, but these are also not a partnership with Google and are intended to protect you from Google's online trackers. Learn more

section1.title: One super⚡charged app, mutiple types of privacy protection
section1.subtitle: The DuckDuckGo app includes our Web and App Tracking Protection, Smarter Encryption, Private Search, Email Protection, and more.
section1.details: See app listings for platform-specific details: iOS, Android, Firefox, Chrome, Edge, and Safari.

section2.title: Search without being tracked.
section2.subtitle: Other search engines track your every search, from where you go to what you buy. We don't track you. Ever.
section2.label: SEARCH PROTETION

section3.title: Stop creepy tracking from Facebook and Google.
section3.subtitle: DuckDuckGo's powerful tracker blocking stops most trackers before they even load, evading hidden data collectors and speeding up websites.
section3.label: Web Tracking Protection

section4.title: Intercept and remove email trackers.
section4.subtitle: 85% of emails sent through Duck Addresses contained hidden email trackers before we stripped them out. Email Protection zaps most trackers and forwards email to your regular inbox so you can read in peace.
section4.label: App Tracking Protection

section5.title: Block app trackers, day or night.
section5.subtitle: Over 96% of popular free Android apps we tested allow other companies to invade your privacy, like using your location to map everywhere you go. Stop most of their spying and take back control on Android!
section5.label: App Tracking Protection

section6.title: They auction off your data to the highest bidder.
section6.description: Companies use your data to create detailed profiles about you that even include info on your friends and families. This lets companies follow us around with ads so creepy it can seem like our devices are listening in on our conversations (even when they aren't).

section7.title: They're doing more than just following you around with creepy ads.
section7.description: These profiles are used to influence what you see online, and can lead to manipulation and discrimination based on what they know about you.

midsection.label: App Tracking Protection
midsection.title: Google, Facebook, and other companies make your personal data their product.
midsection.subtitle: Even everyday online activities like purchasing groceries or looking up the local weather can result in dozens of companies tracking you.

statistics.description1: of popular sites have third-party trackers.

statistics.description3: of popular Android apps have third-party trackers.

additionalInfo.title: Trackers lurk nearly everywhere.
additionalInfo.description: Trackers can pick up your location history, search history, browsing history, and more, inferring your age, ethnicity, gender, interests, and habits.
additionalInfo.note: † Based on research for Web, Email, Apps.

miniCards.text1: The company best known for its search engine is launching a new set of tools aimed at creating an ‘easy button’ for protecting your data online.

miniCards.text2: Tackling email privacy has been a major goal for DuckDuckGo, as the company pushes for privacy-friendly methods for various online tasks.

miniCards.text3: It doesn’t allow targeted advertising, results are not based on your search history, and you’ll see fewer ads based on your search. It’s easy to use and install, too.

miniCards.text4: The 13-year-old company appears to be in a prime position to fulfill internet users’ increasing desire for privacy in an age of data leaks, breaches and scandals.
